metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17522 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: ** DISPUTED ** Lib/webbrowser.py in Python through 3.6.3 does not validatestrings before launching the program specified by the BROWSER environmentvariable, which might allow remote attackers to conduct argument-injectionattacks via a crafted URL. NOTE: a software maintainer indicates thatexploitation is impossible because the code relies on subprocess.Popen andthe default shell=False setting.

criterions.comment: python3.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
